```{r}
# seperating the year 2017 from the ginigdp

```

```{r}
#Fetching change in GDP
GDP <- tidyjoined %>%
  select(NUTS2, Country, Time, `GDP Million EUR`, Population) %>%
  group_by(NUTS2, Country, Time) %>%
  summarise(
    "N2GDPSUM" = sum(`GDP Million EUR`),
    "N2POPSUM" = sum(Population),
    "N2GDPCAP"  = (N2GDPSUM * 1000000)/ N2POPSUM)%>%
  dplyr::filter(Time > "2015" & Time < "2018")

```
